required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High (100mg) Versus Standard (60mg) Loading Dose of Prasugrel in Patients With ST-elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI), Undergoing Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)
clinical_study.official_title: High (100mg) Versus Standard (60mg) Loading Dose of Prasugrel in Patients With ST-elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI), Undergoing Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multi-center, non-randomized, controlled study in 2 sequential groups of P2Y12 inhibitor-naive consecutive STEMI patients undergoing primary PCI. Following aspirin 325 mg LD, patients will receive 60 mg or 100 mg of prasugrel, respectively. Platelet reactivity (PR)will be assessed at Hour 0 (before prasugrel's administration immediately prior to PCI) and at Hours 0.5, 1, 2, 4 thereafter. Platelet function testing (in PRU) will be performed with the VerifyNow (Accumetrics Inc., San Diego, CA, USA) P2Y12 function assay.

primary_outcome.measure: Platelet reactivity in Platelet reactivity units (PRU) at Hour 2
primary_outcome.description: Platelet reactivity in Platelet reactivity units (PRU) 2 hours post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet reactivity in platelet reactivity units (PRU)at hour 1
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet reactivity in platelet reactivity units (PRU)1 hour post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet reactivity in platelet reactivity units (PRU)at hour 0.5
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet reactivity in platelet reactivity units (PRU)0.5 hour post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet reactivity in platelet reactivity units (PRU)at hour 4
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet reactivity in platelet reactivity units (PRU)4 hours post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) at 0.5 hour
secondary_outcome.description: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) 0.5 hour post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) at 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) 1 hour post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) at 2 hour
secondary_outcome.description: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) 2 hours post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) at 4 hour
secondary_outcome.description: High platelet reactivity rate (208 PRU threshold) 4 hours post randomization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ST elevation myocardial infarction
- Pain onset <12 hours
- Age >18 and <75 years
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of stroke/transient ischemic attack
- oral anticoagulation
- hemodynamic instability
- platelet count <100000/Î¼L
- hematocrit <30%
- creatinine clearance <30 ml/min
- severe hepatic dysfunction
- active bleeding
- weight <60 Kg
- periprocedural IIb/IIIa inhibitor administration
